positive: I was between this and a macbook pro14", but I'm super satisfied and felt like it was a great deal to upgrade the RAM to 32 and the 1 tb HD w the free office pro acrobat std.
So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.
AMD on the other hand works like a dream, and Linux support for AMDGPU is the best of the bunch by far.
negative: No adobe suite , no gaming, no autocad, no ms office, its useless
But given no desktop-replacement GPUs from AMD right now (no 9000 mobile series yet) it seems the high-end gaming will be stealing our AMD CPU supply for some time to come.
I wanted to do a bit of gaming on the device (ie: ZZZ and Dota2), but the performance is quite horrendous.

positive: So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.
They stay good, don't get me wrong : but at any price range there's pretty much always a better deal.
Speakers are really good too but make sure Dolby Atmos is enabled for the best sound.
negative: I'm stuck choosing between a laptop with a terrible keyboard or one with a terrible screen, and honestly neither feels like a win.

My main worry with a Lenovo is that the last one I got, I ended up returning it because it ran into a TON of issues within a week of barely using it - BSOD for no reason, wouldn't correct to wifi after initial updates, delayed keyboard feedback, stuff like that.
Was looking at the 360 ones, but I was a tad worried about the glass screen (hopefully I'm thinking of the right thing) cause I tend to damage things just by looking at them, somehow.

positive: So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.
The screen is great, vibrant and with great blacks, despite being a IPS screen.
Very bright, very colorful, great pixel density, 120hz, good touch implementation, and completely free of defects.
negative: I'm stuck choosing between a laptop with a terrible keyboard or one with a terrible screen, and honestly neither feels like a win.
I wanted to do a bit of gaming on the device (ie: ZZZ and Dota2), but the performance is quite horrendous.
the hate is warranted, especially for the desktop variants which are extremely poor performance for the price you pay.

positive: A few things to add in; Laptop keyboard so far is fantastic, they feel more like the good old membrane keyboard; and definitely feels a lot better to type on compare to laptops like Zephyrus.
So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.
Battery is great, response is snappy, touchpad is fine, not great, screen is lovely.
negative: Lenovos webshop has been notorious for having odd bugs, my father purchased a laptop years ago and for some reason the payment failed so he got pissed off and went to a store and bought one.
I wanted to do a bit of gaming on the device (ie: ZZZ and Dota2), but the performance is quite horrendous.
